   19: %%
   20: -module(erl_boot_server_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include("kernel_test_lib.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   26: 
   27: -export([start/1, start_link/1, stop/1, add/1, delete/1, responses/1]).
   28: 
   29: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   30: %% Test suite for erl_boot_server.
   31: %%
   32: %% This module is mainly tested in the erl_prim_loader_SUITE,
   33: %% but the interface functions are tested here.
   34: %%
   35: %% Changed for the new erl_boot_server for R3A by Bjorn Gustavsson.
   36: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   37: 
   38: suite() ->
   39:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   40:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   41: 
   42: all() -> 
   43:     [start, start_link, stop, add, delete, responses].
   44: 
   45: groups() -> 
   46:     [].
   47: 
   48: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
   49: 
   50:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
   51:        "~n      Config: ~p"
   52:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
   53: 
   54:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite([{allow_skip, false} | Config0]) of
   55:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
   56:             SKIP;
   57: 
   58:         Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
   59:             
   60:             ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
   61:                "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
   62:             
   63:             Config1
   64:     end.
   65: 
   66: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
   67: 
   68:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
   69:        "~n      Config: ~p"
   70:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
   71: 
   72:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
   73: 
   74:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
   75:             "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
   76: 
   77:     Config1.
   78: 
   79: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   80:     Config.
   81: 
   82: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   83:     Config.
   84: 
   85: 
   86: -define(all_ones, {255, 255, 255, 255}).
   87: 
   88: %% Tests the erl_boot_server:start/1 function.
   89: start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   90:     [Host1, Host2] = ?GOOD_HOSTS(2),
   91: 
   92:     %% Bad arguments.
   93:     BadHost = "bad__host",
   94:     {error, {badarg, {}}} = erl_boot_server:start({}),
   95:     {error, {badarg, atom}} = erl_boot_server:start(atom),
   96:     {error, {badarg, [atom, BadHost]}} =
   97: 	erl_boot_server:start([atom, BadHost]),
   98:     {error, {badarg, [Host1, BadHost]}} =
   99: 	erl_boot_server:start([Host1, BadHost]),
  100: 
  101:     %% Test once.
  102:     {ok, Pid1} = erl_boot_server:start([Host1]),
  103:     {error, {already_started, Pid1}} =
  104: 	erl_boot_server:start([Host1]),
  105:     exit(Pid1, kill),
  106: 
  107:     %% Test again.
  108:     ct:sleep(1),
  109:     {ok, Pid2} = erl_boot_server:start([Host1, Host2]),
  110:     {error, {already_started, Pid2}} =
  111: 	erl_boot_server:start([Host1, Host2]),
  112:     exit(Pid2, kill),
  113:     ct:sleep(1),
  114: 
  115:     ok.
  116: 
  117: %% Tests the erl_boot_server:start_link/1 function.
  118: start_link(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  119:     [Host1, Host2] = ?GOOD_HOSTS(2),
  120: 
  121:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  122:     {error, {badarg, {}}} = erl_boot_server:start_link({}),
  123:     {error, {badarg, atom}} = erl_boot_server:start_link(atom),
  124:     BadHost = "bad__host",
  125:     {error, {badarg, [atom, BadHost]}} =
  126: 	erl_boot_server:start_link([atom, BadHost]),
  127: 
  128:     {ok, Pid1} = erl_boot_server:start_link([Host1]),
  129:     {error, {already_started, Pid1}} =
  130: 	erl_boot_server:start_link([Host1]),
  131:     shutdown(Pid1),
  132: 
  133:     {ok, Pid2} = erl_boot_server:start_link([Host1, Host2]),
  134:     {error, {already_started, Pid2}} =
  135: 	erl_boot_server:start_link([Host1, Host2]),
  136:     shutdown(Pid2),
  137:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  138: 
  139:     ok.
  140: 
  141: %% Tests that no processes are left if a boot server is killed.
  142: stop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  143:     [Host1] = ?GOOD_HOSTS(1),
  144: 
  145:     %% Start a boot server and kill it.  Make sure that any helper processes
  146:     %% dies.
  147:     %% Make sure the inet_gethost_native server is already started,
  148:     %% otherwise it will make this test fail:
  149:     inet:getaddr(localhost, inet),
  150:     Before = processes(),
  151:     {ok, Pid} = erl_boot_server:start([Host1]),
  152:     New = processes() -- [Pid|Before],
  153:     exit(Pid, kill),
  154:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  155:     case [P || P <- New, is_process_alive(P)] of
  156: 	[] ->
  157: 	    ok;
  158: 	NotKilled ->
  159: 	    ct:fail({not_killed, NotKilled})
  160:     end,
  161:     ok.
  162: 
  163: %% Tests the erl_boot_server:add/1 function.
  164: add(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  165:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  166:     {ok, Pid1} = erl_boot_server:start_link([]),
  167:     [] = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  168:     [Host1, Host2, Host3] = ?GOOD_HOSTS(3),
  169: 
  170:     %% Try bad values.
  171:     {error, {badarg, {}}} = erl_boot_server:add_slave({}),
  172:     {error, {badarg, [atom]}} = erl_boot_server:add_slave([atom]),
  173:     BadHost = "bad__host",
  174:     {error, {badarg, BadHost}} = erl_boot_server:add_slave(BadHost),
  175:     [] = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  176: 
  177:     %% Add good host names.
  178:     {ok, Ip1} = inet:getaddr(Host1, inet),
  179:     {ok, Ip2} = inet:getaddr(Host2, inet),
  180:     {ok, Ip3} = inet:getaddr(Host3, inet),
  181:     MIp1 = {?all_ones, Ip1},
  182:     MIp2 = {?all_ones, Ip2},
  183:     MIp3 = {?all_ones, Ip3},
  184:     ok = erl_boot_server:add_slave(Host1),
  185:     [MIp1] = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  186:     ok = erl_boot_server:add_slave(Host2),
  187:     M_Ip1_Ip2 = lists:sort([MIp1, MIp2]),
  188:     M_Ip1_Ip2 = lists:sort(erl_boot_server:which_slaves()),
  189:     ok = erl_boot_server:add_slave(Host3),
  190:     M_Ip1_Ip2_Ip3 = lists:sort([MIp3|M_Ip1_Ip2]),
  191:     M_Ip1_Ip2_Ip3 = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  192: 
  193:     %% Add duplicate names.
  194:     ok = erl_boot_server:add_slave(Host3),
  195:     M_Ip1_Ip2_Ip3 = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  196: 
  197:     %% More bad names.
  198:     {error, {badarg, BadHost}} = erl_boot_server:add_slave(BadHost),
  199:     M_Ip1_Ip2_Ip3 = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  200: 
  201:     %% Cleanup.
  202:     shutdown(Pid1),
  203:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  204:     ok.
  205: 
  206: %% Tests the erl_boot_server:delete/1 function.
  207: delete(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  208:     OldFlag = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  209: 
  210:     [Host1, Host2, Host3] = ?GOOD_HOSTS(3),
  211:     {ok, Ip1} = inet:getaddr(Host1, inet),
  212:     {ok, Ip2} = inet:getaddr(Host2, inet),
  213:     {ok, Ip3} = inet:getaddr(Host3, inet),
  214:     MIp1 = {?all_ones, Ip1},
  215:     MIp2 = {?all_ones, Ip2},
  216:     MIp3 = {?all_ones, Ip3},
  217: 
  218:     {ok, Pid1} = erl_boot_server:start_link([Host1, Host2, Host3]),
  219:     M_Ip123 = lists:sort([MIp1, MIp2, MIp3]),
  220:     M_Ip123 = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  221: 
  222:     %% Do some bad attempts and check that the list of slaves is intact.
  223:     {error, {badarg, {}}} = erl_boot_server:delete_slave({}),
  224:     {error, {badarg, [atom]}} = erl_boot_server:delete_slave([atom]),
  225:     BadHost = "bad__host",
  226:     {error, {badarg, BadHost}} = erl_boot_server:delete_slave(BadHost),
  227:     M_Ip123 = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  228: 
  229:     %% Delete Host2 and make sure it's gone.
  230:     ok = erl_boot_server:delete_slave(Host2),
  231:     M_Ip13 = lists:sort([MIp1, MIp3]),
  232:     M_Ip13 = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  233: 
  234:     ok = erl_boot_server:delete_slave(Host1),
  235:     [MIp3] = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  236:     ok = erl_boot_server:delete_slave(Host1),
  237:     [MIp3] = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  238: 
  239:     {error, {badarg, BadHost}} = erl_boot_server:delete_slave(BadHost),
  240:     [MIp3] = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  241: 
  242:     ok = erl_boot_server:delete_slave(Ip3),
  243:     [] = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  244:     ok = erl_boot_server:delete_slave(Ip3),
  245:     [] = erl_boot_server:which_slaves(),
  246: 
  247:     shutdown(Pid1),
  248:     process_flag(trap_exit, OldFlag),
  249:     ok.
  250: 
  251: %% Tests erl_boot_server responses to slave requests.
  252: responses(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  253:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  254:     %% Copy from inet_boot.hrl
  255:     EBOOT_PORT = 4368,
  256:     EBOOT_REQUEST = "EBOOTQ",
  257:     EBOOT_REPLY =   "EBOOTR",
  258: 
  259:     {ok,Host} = inet:gethostname(),
  260:     {ok,Ip} = inet:getaddr(Host, inet),
  261: 
  262:     ThisVer = erlang:system_info(version),
  263: 
  264:     {ok,BootPid} = erl_boot_server:start_link([Host]),
  265: 
  266:     %% Send junk
  267:     S1 = open_udp(Ip),
  268:     prim_inet:sendto(S1, Ip, EBOOT_PORT, ["0"]),
  269:     receive
  270: 	What ->
  271: 	    close_udp(S1),
  272: 	    ct:fail({"got unexpected response",What})
  273:     after 100 ->
  274: 	    ok
  275:     end,
  276: 
  277:     %% Req from a slave with same erlang vsn.
  278:     S2 = open_udp(Ip),
  279:     prim_inet:sendto(S2, Ip, EBOOT_PORT, [EBOOT_REQUEST,ThisVer]),
  280:     receive
  281: 	{udp,S2,_Ip,_Port1,Resp1} ->
  282: 	    close_udp(S2),
  283: 	    EBOOT_REPLY = string:substr(Resp1, 1, length(EBOOT_REPLY)),
  284: 	    Rest1 = string:substr(Resp1, length(EBOOT_REPLY)+1, length(Resp1)),
  285: 	    [_,_,_ | ThisVer] = Rest1
  286:     after 2000 ->
  287: 	    close_udp(S2),
  288: 	    ct:fail("no boot server response; same vsn")
  289:     end,
  290: 
  291:     %% Req from a slave with other erlang vsn.
  292:     S3 = open_udp(Ip),
  293:     prim_inet:sendto(S3, Ip, EBOOT_PORT, [EBOOT_REQUEST,"1.0"]),
  294:     receive
  295: 	Anything ->
  296: 	    close_udp(S3),
  297: 	    ct:fail({"got unexpected response",Anything})
  298:     after 100 ->
  299: 	    ok
  300:     end,
  301: 
  302:     %% Kill the boot server and wait for it to disappear.
  303:     unlink(BootPid),
  304:     BootPidMref = erlang:monitor(process, BootPid),
  305:     exit(BootPid, kill),
  306:     receive
  307: 	{'DOWN',BootPidMref,_,_,_} -> ok
  308:     end,
  309: 
  310:     {ok,BootPid2} = erl_boot_server:start_link(["127.0.0.1"]),
  311: 
  312:     %% Req from slave with invalid ip address.
  313:     S4 = open_udp(Ip),
  314:     Ret =
  315: 	case Ip of
  316: 	    {127,0,0,1} ->
  317: 		{comment,"IP address for this host is 127.0.0.1"};
  318: 	    _ ->
  319: 		prim_inet:sendto(S4, Ip, EBOOT_PORT,
  320: 				 [EBOOT_REQUEST,ThisVer]),
  321: 		receive
  322: 		    Huh ->
  323: 			close_udp(S4),
  324: 			ct:fail({"got unexpected response",Huh})
  325: 		after 100 ->
  326: 			ok
  327: 		end
  328: 	end,
  329: 
  330:     unlink(BootPid2),
  331:     exit(BootPid2, kill),
  332: 
  333:     %% Now wait for any late unexpected messages.
  334:     receive
  335: 	Whatever ->
  336: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_message,Whatever})
  337:     after 4000 ->
  338: 	    close_udp(S1),
  339: 	    close_udp(S3),
  340: 	    close_udp(S4),
  341: 	    ok
  342:     end,
  343: 
  344:     Ret.
  345: 
  346: shutdown(Pid) ->
  347:     exit(Pid, shutdown),
  348:     receive
  349: 	{'EXIT', Pid, shutdown} ->
  350: 	    ok
  351:     after 1000 ->
  352: 	    %% The timeout used to be 1 ms, which could be too short time for the
  353: 	    %% SMP emulator on a slow computer with one CPU.
  354: 	    ct:fail(shutdown)
  355:     end.
  356: 
  357:     
  358: open_udp(Ip) ->
  359:     {ok, S} = prim_inet:open(udp, inet, dgram),
  360:     ok = prim_inet:setopts(S, [{mode,list},{active,true},
  361: 			       {deliver,term},{broadcast,true}]),
  362:     {ok,_} = prim_inet:bind(S, Ip, 0),
  363:     S.
  364: 
  365: close_udp(S) ->
  366:     prim_inet:close(S).
